intro: Cryptandra pogonoloba subsp. pogonoloba, commonly known as the mountain cryptandra, is a shrub native to the southern regions of Western Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, narrow lance-shaped leaves, and small, fragrant white flowers that appear in clusters. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal heathlands. Due to its restricted distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
